content:
• Thursday, December 28, 2017

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: TXMD +4.2%. QIWI +2.8%. HL +2.2%. CRNT +1.5%. MYL +1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 11 Comments
  • TXMD

    TherapeuticsMD submits NDA for TX-001HR

    • TherapeuticsMD (NYSEMKT:TXMD) announces submitting a New Drug Application for TX-001HR for moderate-to-severe vasomotor symptoms due to menopause.
    • The NDA is supported with the Phase 3 Replenish trial.   
    • TherapeuticsMD shares are up 5.4% aftermarket.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 5 Comments
  • DPLO

    FDA finds issues at Diplomat Pharmacy

    • The FDA today published a Form 483 letter of objectionable observations from an inspection of Diplomat Pharmacy (NYSE:DPLO).
    • Among the findings were the release of drugs of incorrect strengths and non-sterile areas.
    • DPLO initially dove lower on the release, but has returned to its previous level, up 0.25% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • XPLR

    Xplore Technologies updates insider buying, full-year guidance

    • Xplore Technologies (NASDAQ:XPLR) updates on recent insider buying following November’s CEO transition and reiterates its full-year outlook.
    • Multiple executives purchased 42,800 shares at an average price of $3.10 per share from November 14 to December 8. The execs include acting CEO Tom Wilkinson, VP of Marketing John Graff, and VP of Sales for Enterprise and the Americas Randy Denny.
    • Full-year outlook has revenue from $75M to $85M with gross margin from 28% to 30% and operating expenses between $23M and $25M.
    • Xplore shares are down 1.1%.
    • Correction: Corrected typo listing the purchases as sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • SNWV

    Sanuwave +73% on FDA marketing approval

    • The FDA permits marketing of Sanuwave’s (OTCQB:SNWV) Dermapace System, a shock wave device to treat diabetic foot ulcers.  
    • The CDC estimates that 30.3M people in the U.S. have been diagnosed with diabetes and about 25% will experience a foot ulcer at some point. Amputation can become necessary when poor circulation prevents the ulcer from healing.  
    • Sanuwave shares are up 73% to $0.25. 
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • LINU-OLD

    LiNiu Technology soars after earnings

    • LiNiu Technology Group (NASDAQ:LINU-OLD) is up 120% after posting results for the first half of the fiscal year.
    • Due to the closing of VIP gaming operations by the company, revenue fell from $28.5M to $1.45M amid a corporate reset.
    • "During the first half of 2017, we concentrated on launching the LiNiu Network and creating awareness for agricultural customers and suppliers to utilize our new platform," notes LiNiu co-CEO Wang Shun Yang.
    • "As we move into 2018, we plan to further ramp up our efforts to drive customer awareness and traffic by establishing new relationships with larger online platforms." he adds.
    • Previously: LiNiu Technology reports 1H results (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • SONC

    Guggenheim sees 10% upside for Sonic

    • Guggenheim Partners backs ups its bullish view on Sonic (SONC -0.5%) in a fresh note to clients.
    • The investment firm keeps a Buy rating and lifts its price target to $31 to rep 10% upside potential for the restaurant stock.
    • Sonic has traded between $22.11 and $30.05 over the last 52 weeks.
    • Previously: What next after sizzling pace of restaurant M&A? (Dec. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: LINU-OLD +105%. LIVE +79%. VTVT +35%. WATT +32%. KBSF +28%. DRAD +21%. TCCO +21%.FBIO +15%. YECO-OLD +13%. WMLP-OLD +14%.
    • Losers: TEUM -27%. SGLB -21%. CERC -20%. AMCN -21%. OTC:IGC -17%. NXTD -16%. EKSO -15%. IPWR -14%. BVSN -12%. CLMT -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 13 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: GCAP +8%. AMBC +7%.NHLD +6%
    • Losers: SGLB -22%. SIEB -11%. OTCPK:FSAM -8%. JTPY -7%. MARPS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • VTVT

    VTv Therapeutics +36.3% on insider buying

    • VTv Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VTVT) director Ronald O. Perelman discloses acquiring 50K shares for $4.0344 or about $201.7K
    • The shares bring Perelman’s stake up to 27%.
    • VTv shares are up 36.3%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • RGLD

    Royal Gold down nearly 7% on mine suspension, downgrade

    • Due to a lack of sufficient water resources, mill processing operations at the Mount Milligan mine have been temporarily suspended. There should be enough water to restart by the end of January, and full capacity should be reached after April's spring melt.
    • Source: Press Release
    • "Confidence in the turnaround has clearly been shaken again," says Canaccord, downgrading to Hold from Buy.
    • RGLD -6.7%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 3 Comments

  • Consumers - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM

    • Gainers: WATT +34%. KBSF +28%.LTEA +8%. LBY +7%. VNCE +7%.
    • Losers: FTFT -13%. OTIV -8%. SQBG -7%. NVFY -7%. ADOM -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • SUPN

    B. Riley raises its Supernus Pharma price target

    • B. Riley raises its Supernus Pharma (NASDAQ:SUPN) price target from $50 to $54 and reiterates its Buy rating.
    • The firm cites 2018 tailwinds including sales growth for epilepsy drugs Trokendi XR and Oxtellar XR, development for SPN-810 (for impulsive aggression) and SPN-812 (ADHD), and development of Oxtellar XR in bipolar disorder.
    • Firm expects management visibility in January with scheduled presentations and investor meetings. 
    • Supernus shares are up 3.6% to $40.10.       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • CMCM

    Cheetah Mobile appoints 58.com CEO to board

    • Cheetah Mobile (NYSE:CMCM) appoints 58.com CEO Michael Jinbo Yao and Matrix Partners founder Michael Lingye Zuo as independent directors effective today.
    • Michael Jinbo Yao will also join the corporate governance and nominating committee while Michael Lingye Zuo will join the audit, compensation, and corporate governance committees.   
    • Cheetah Mobile shares are up 5%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: VTVT +19%. DRAD +17%.AMPE +11%. SRNE +10%. SNOA +8%.
    • Losers: CERC -19%. EKSO -14%. FATE -9%. SKLN -9%. RIOT -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 9 Comments
  • GCAP

    Gain Capital up 10% on Mox Capital boost

    • Unlike some "nonsense" crypto plays, Gain Capital (NYSE:GCAP) is set to reap real benefit from Bitcoin, says Mox in a new long report.
    • The company already launched crypto trading in the U.K. - offering both long and short exposure, and leverage - and is set to roll that out globally within weeks.
    • Shares up 9.75%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • WATT

    Energous competitor receives FCC approval

    • Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) competitor Powercast receives FCC approval for its own at-range wireless charging transmitter. The approval came earlier this week alongside Energous' approval.
    • The Powercast transmitter can charge up to 80 feet away but only for small, low-power devices.
    • The company says power delivery rates improve with proximity. Power-hungry smartwatches and fitness bands should be charged within two feet and keyboard and mice within six feet.
    • Energous says its transmitter can recharge multiple devices within three feet. Energous received approval under the FCC’s Part 18 rules, which allow for higher-power operations that the Part 15 rule that Powercast was approved under.
    • Powercast hopes to have products out in 3Q18 with an initial price of $100.
    • Energous shares are up 25.4%.
    • Previously: Roth Capital raises its Energous price target; FCC chair tweets confirmation (Dec. 28)
    • Update: Post updated for timeline clarity.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 37 Comments
  • JBHT

    J.B. Hunt Transport falls back after guidance update

    • J.B. Hunt Transport Services (JBHT -1.9%) trades lower after posting a guidance update.
    • The trucking company expects Q4 revenue of $1.90B to $2.0B vs. $1.91B consensus and Q4 EPS of $0.98 to $1.03 vs. $1.02 consensus. The company also anticipates operating income $145M to $155M for the quarter. Management used an effective tax rate of 37.6% in making the forecast.
    • Although the numbers were solid from J.B. Hunt, shares have already tracked higher over the last month on investor expectations for a strong quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • AMBC

    Ambac up 2.5% on deal with bondholders

    • Ambac (NASDAQ:AMBC) has reached agreement with a group of bondholders for the company to purchase from them certain COFINA bonds. After the deal, Ambac will own 58% of its insured COFINA paper.
    • Alongside, the bondholder group has withdrawn its objection to the plan to exit the segregated account.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares are higher by 2.5% in early action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 6 Comments
  • WNDW

    SolarWindow on the move

    • While the stock has almost doubled since the beginning of the month, SolarWindow Technologies (OTCPK:WNDW) has tumbled in early trade, now down 10%.
    • Recent posts from Twitter: "A decade after $WNDW started promoting its stock, it has yet to sell a single 'SolarWindow,'" as well as "$WNDW, assets $832k, revenue $0, market cap ~$345MM. This is bound to end well, right?"
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 35 Comments
  • ODT

    Odonate Therapeutics initiates Phase 3 trial for tesetaxel

    • Odonate Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ODT) initiates the Phase 3 CONTESSA trial of tesetaxel in patients with locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer.
    • The trial’s primary endpoint is progression-free survival with secondary efficacy endpoints of overall survival, objective response rate, disease control rate, and patient-reported outcomes.
    • Odonate shares are down 1.8% premarket.        
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • LIVE +81% on FY result.
    • LINU-OLD +36% on 1H result.
    • DRAD +36% on contracts sale.
    • EROS +14% on Amazon inclusion.
    • WATT +12% on positive analyst action.
    • HTGM +7%.
    • MARK +6%.
    • HMNY +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • TEUM -14%.
    • CLSN -13%.
    • NXTD -11%.
    • RVLT -9% after guidance update.
    • DPW -10%.
    • GROW -9% on Korea crypto crackdown.
    • FTFT -9%.
    • EKSO -8% on increasing the authorized number of shares of the company's common stock.
    • OTC:IGC -8% on India to breach fiscal deficit target after additional borrowing.
    • RIOT -7% on Korea crypto crackdown.
    • SSC-OLD -6% on Korea crypto crackdown.
    • NETE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 5 Comments
  • M

    Telsey sees Macy's tracking higher

    • Macy's (NYSE:M) still looks attractive to Telsey Advisory Group analyst Dana Telsey despite the strong run by the department store since Black Friday.
    • Telsey notes that Macy's only trades at a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 10.2 vs. 17.5 for the sector. A year of relatively easy sales comparables is also on the calendar for Macy's.
    • Macy's is kept at Market Perform by Telsey, but the price target is lifted to $28.
    • Shares of Macy's are up 0.43% on brisk volume in the premarket session.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 19 Comments
  • SNOA

    Sonoma Pharmaceuticals +8.9% on Benchmark initiation

    • The Benchmark Company initiates Sonoma Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNOA) with a Speculative Buy rating and a $10 price target.
    • The firm predicts Sonoma will reach break-even with cash flow in the December 2019 quarter due to operational improvements including an expanding product mix, declining rebates, and small price increases.
    • Benchmark says Sonoma could reach profitability using the $9.9M of cash on hand but might need another $1M to $2M.  
    • Sonoma shares are up 8.9% premarket to $5.25. 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • EROS

    Eros pops after Amazon inclusion

    • Eros International (NYSE:EROS) soars after announcing that its streaming service is now available to Amazon Prime members for a subscription fee of $7.99.
    • "Eros Now's integration with Amazon Channels in the US and UK further empowers us to reach out to millions of subscribers and provide them with rich and compelling content, from movies to music to TV content," says Eros Digital CEO Rishika Lulla Singh.
    • EROS +15.82% premarket to $11.35. The 52-week high for shares is $16.90.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • STCC

    Blockchain moonshot for microcap Sterling Consolidated

    • Sterling Consolidated (OTCQB:STCC) announces plans for a decentralized international marketplace for O-rings called DiMo.
    • "We believe that, based on its highly fragmented structure with thousands of distributors and very few suppliers in Asia, the O-ring industry lends itself perfectly to utilization of the Blockchain and smart contract technology," says Sterling CEO Darren DeRosa.
    • Sterling has partnered with BlockchainDriven in its crypto efforts.
    • STCC closed up 179.% to $0.1397 yesterday before the announcement hit. Today's action could be interesting to say the least.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • WATT

    Roth Capital raises its Energous price target; FCC chair tweets confirmation

    • Roth Capital raises its Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) price target from $22.80 to $45.80 and maintains a Buy rating.
    • Energous share are up 8.6% premarket to $25.74. Shares are up 156% this week.
    • Previously: Energous skies 89% after winning FCC certification (Dec. 27)
    • Update with analyst comments: Roth analyst William Gibson cites the FCC certification as setting the stage for new WattUp tech with more power, functionality, and scale.
    • Gibson notes that the first products are expected to launch in Q1, and he expects the FCC approval process to speed up over time. 
    • The analyst says Energous needs more money with only $20.2M in cash as of Q3. Funds could arrive through strategic partnerships such as Dialog exercising its warrants.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • FCC confirmation: FCC Chairman Ajit Pai tweets about the approval with a link to Energous’ announcement press release.    
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 6 Comments
  • EKSO

    Ekso files to double common shares

    • Ekso Bionics (NASDAQ:EKSO) disclosed that it filed to increase the authorized number of shares of the company's common stock from 71,428,571 shares to 141,428,571 shares on Dec. 22.
    • The charter amendment was approved by the company’s stockholders at a Special Meeting of Stockholders held on Dec. 21.
    • EKSO -11.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 36 Comments
  • ICPT

    Intercept Pharmaceuticals shifts announcement of NASH trial

    • Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) shifts its guidance for announcing the Phase 3 REVERSE trial in NASH patients with compensated cirrhosis.
    • The announcement will now come in 1Q18 rather than at the end of 2017. 
    • Intercept shares are up 4.5% premarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 15 Comments
